This is a problem. We laziliy restore and instantiate breakpoints, but we 
cannot do it in response to a resource delta.

There's nothing we can do to prevent breakpoints being initialized as the result
of a resource changed callback. However, we can try to reduce the chances of
this happening.

Heavily refactored (read: rewrote) our JavaModelListener. It now checks if java
element deltas contain package fragment root removals before it asks the
breakpoint manager for breakpoints. This should significantly reduce the chance
of the JavaModelListener causing breakpoint initialization.

As an added bonus, the JavaModelListener is now much more efficient.
*** Bug 14988 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
